analyte.description: Represents the specific chemical substance or biomarker measured in a laboratory test or clinical exam.

anatomic_site.description: Indicates the specific location or region of the body where a procedure or service is performed.

approach.description: Defines the surgical or procedural technique used to access the body (e.g., open, laparoscopic, endoscopic).

assessment_tool.description: Specifies the tool or instrument used in psychological or functional assessment (e.g., cognitive test, hearing test).

contrast.description: Indicates whether contrast media was used during an imaging procedure (values: with_contrast, without_contrast, both).

component_type.description: Specifies the type of blood product used in transfusion or transfusion preparation.

donor_status.description: Indicates the type or relationship of the blood donor (e.g., volunteer, autologous).

recipient_status.description: Specifies the recipient's condition or match status for transfusions (e.g., crossmatched, emergency).

device_type.description: Specifies the type of instrument, implant, or equipment used in a procedure.

delivery_phase.description: Specifies the stage of labor or delivery (e.g., first_stage, second_stage, third_stage, postpartum).

diagnostic_tool.description: Specifies the device or test used for diagnosis in a specialty (e.g., echocardiogram, spirometry).

duration.description: Indicates the expected time span or chronicity of a condition or treatment.

evaluation_scope.description: Specifies the extent of pathological evaluation (e.g., limited, complete, frozen_section).

frequency.description: Describes how often a test, therapy, or evaluation is performed.

goal.description: Specifies the therapeutic intent or functional goal (e.g., rehabilitation, preventive, pain_management).

imaging_view.description: Specifies the projection or angle used during radiographic imaging (e.g., anteroposterior_view, lateral, oblique).

laterality.description: Indicates the side of body involved in a procedure (left, right, bilateral, not_applicable).

material_type.description: Specifies the type of material used in dental restorative procedures (e.g., composite, amalgam).

test_purpose.description: Defines the clinical objective for ordering a test (e.g., screening, diagnostic, monitoring).

test_type.description: Classifies the diagnostic test based on its method or technology (e.g., culture, immunoassay, genetic_test).

therapy_type.description: Describes non-surgical therapeutic interventions (e.g., dialysis, chemotherapy, infusion).

therapist_type.description: Specifies the type of therapist providing rehabilitation services (e.g., physical, occupational).

urgency.description: Indicates the priority level of a test or procedure (e.g., routine, stat).

anesthesia_type.description: Classifies the type of anesthesia administered during a procedure (e.g., general, regional, local).

vaccine_type.description: Specifies the antigen or type of vaccine administered for immunization.

organism_target.description: Specifies the type of pathogen or organism targeted by a test or therapy (e.g., bacteria, virus).

tooth_type.description: Identifies the category or position of the tooth involved in a dental procedure (e.g., molar, incisor).

view_count.description: Indicates the number of imaging views captured during a radiology exam (e.g., single_view, dual_view).

slice_count.description: Specifies the number of slices or cross-sectional images in a CT or MRI scan.

specimen_type.description: Specifies the type of biological specimen collected for testing (e.g., biopsy, blood, CSF).

restoration_scope.description: Indicates the extent of a dental restoration (e.g., single_surface, full_mouth).

procedure_type.description: Indicates the nature of a clinical procedure or service (e.g., screening, diagnostic, therapeutic).

method.description: Specifies the route or method used for a procedure or treatment (e.g., oral, intravenous, inhalation, intramuscular).

target_population.description: Specifies the patient population or demographic targeted by a service or screening (e.g., pediatric, adult, geriatric).

scope_type.description: Specifies the type of endoscopic scope used in a procedure (e.g., colonoscope, gastroscope).

uptake_result.description: Indicates the outcome of radiotracer uptake in a nuclear medicine scan (e.g., normal, increased, decreased, absent).

target_gene_or_locus.description: Specifies the gene or genomic locus targeted by a molecular diagnostic test (e.g., BRCA1, EGFR).
